# Introducing CIPro

This platform empowers businesses to harness the full potential of AI, transforming raw data into actionable insights and strategic advantages.

[Get Started Now](https://ai4biz.tech/) [View Demo](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

![img](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/screen-2.png)

All in one social listening solution

## Our Solution for your business

Get onboard and dive into the data to gain a deeper understanding of your customers

[Get Started Now](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://wordpress.themeholy.com/webteck/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/process_line_3.svg)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/cloud-download-2.png)

1

## Data Collection

Streamline and enhance the efficiency of data collection by seamlessly aggregating information from thousands of diverse sources

[Learn More](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://wordpress.themeholy.com/webteck/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/process_box_3_2.svg)

2

## Data Transformation

Implement advanced data transformation techniques to incorporate natural language processing (NLP) metadata, enhancing the depth and context of your data insights

[Learn More](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://wordpress.themeholy.com/webteck/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/process_box_3_3.svg)

3

## Data Drilldown

Apply flexible filters to see information from various angles

[Learn More](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

## Help You Find The Best Analysis For Your Business

### Trusted and Accurate

Use SASS to define typography styles including font families, sizes, colors, and spacing to create.

### Hired By Top Company

Define a cohesive color scheme using SASS variables to maintain consistency across the landing page.

### Various Categories

Use SASS to define typography styles including font families, sizes, colors, and spacing to create.

![](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/about_7_1-1.png)

Why Use CIPro

## Our Simplified Fast And Effective Steps

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/query.png)

### [Flexible Keywords](https://ai4biz.tech/\#)

Utilize flexible keyword parameters with customizable logic to efficiently filter and refine your data

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/source.png)

### [Diverse data sources](https://ai4biz.tech/\#)

Integrating data from multiple sources to assess brand health across the internet

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/wordcloud.png)

### [Suggesting content sources](https://ai4biz.tech/\#)

Suggesting relevant content sources to follow

### Deepen your understanding of your customers through AI-driven analysis of social media data

[View Demo](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

[CONACT US](https://ai4biz.tech/)

![](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/cta_7_1-1-2.png)

CIPro Feature

## Never miss a thing about your brand

![AI%20for%20Business](https://wordpress.themeholy.com/webteck/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/feature_line.svg)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/project.png)

### Collaborate with your team effortlessly

Effortlessly collaborate with your team, securely back up your projects, create and share projects with colleagues, and customize your dashboard to fit your needs.

- Create a project
- Share it to your colleague

- Customize the dashboard

[Discover More](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

![AI%20for%20Business](https://ai4biz.tech/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/feature-img-7-2-1-1.png)

### Understand your strengths and weaknesses

Monitor both positive and negative discussions surrounding your brand to discern their underlying reasons. Gain insights into your customers' perspectives on various facets of your product or service, including quality, pricing, taste, customer service, and packaging.

- Multilingual
- Aspect-based sentiment analysis

- Content summarization
- Entity comparison

[Get Started Now](https://ai4biz.tech/#)

Customer Feedbacks

## Why Firmable? Because local beats global, every time

Global platforms often lack the depth, accuracy, and context needed to succeed in ANZ. Firmable is built from the ground up for this market – combining precise local data, AI sales intelligence, and a team in your time zone who has your back.

### Sell smarter with an AI platform built from the ground up

Our AI agents orchestrate sales plays based on buying signals and advanced account intelligence – helping your team prioritise high-intent prospects and optimise every touchpoint. This is AI designed for ANZ sales teams, fully embedded into your workflows.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/largest-b2b-database-1400x881-1.webp)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image-91-1-1400x1050-1.png)

### Own the most complete and accurate ANZ sales database

Say goodbye to patchy, out-of-date data. With over 1.5m companies and 10m verified contacts, Firmable delivers unrivalled coverage and accuracy – enriched with localised +61/64 mobile numbers, ABN/NZBN mapping, ANZSIC codes, and Do Not Call register checks. You get a data foundation built for ANZ that global platforms simply can’t match.

### Turn data into actions that your competitors miss

Firmable connects external market intelligence with your internal CRM data to uncover the best accounts to pursue and the right people to contact. Spot opportunities the moment they emerge, personalise your outreach, and start conversations that lead to more wins.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Sales-intelligence-Block-3.png)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/phone-support-2-1.png)

### Work with a partner who’s in your corner – and your time zone

From start-ups scaling outbound to enterprise sales teams, Firmable is easy to adopt, easy to scale, and fully supported by people who know the local sales landscape. We’re invested in your success and measure ours by the growth you achieve.

Win more deals with ANZ's #1 AI sales intelligence platform

Firmable combines the most accurate Australia & New Zealand B2B database with rich buying signals and AI agents – so your team can find, prioritise, and convert the right buyers faster.

    Effortlessly integrate with your existing CRM and outreach platforms

Why Firmable? Because local beats global, every time

Global platforms often lack the depth, accuracy, and context needed to succeed in ANZ. Firmable is built from the ground up for this market – combining precise local data, AI sales intelligence, and a team in your time zone who has your back.

Sell smarter with an AI platform built from the ground up

Our AI agents orchestrate sales plays based on buying signals and advanced account intelligence – helping your team prioritise high-intent prospects and optimise every touchpoint. This is AI designed for ANZ sales teams, fully embedded into your workflows.

Own the most complete and accurate ANZ sales database

Say goodbye to patchy, out-of-date data. With over 1.5m companies and 10m verified contacts, Firmable delivers unrivalled coverage and accuracy – enriched with localised +61/64 mobile numbers, ABN/NZBN mapping, ANZSIC codes, and Do Not Call register checks. You get a data foundation built for ANZ that global platforms simply can’t match.

Turn data into actions that your competitors miss

Firmable connects external market intelligence with your internal CRM data to uncover the best accounts to pursue and the right people to contact. Spot opportunities the moment they emerge, personalise your outreach, and start conversations that lead to more wins.

Work with a partner who’s in your corner – and your time zone

From start-ups scaling outbound to enterprise sales teams, Firmable is easy to adopt, easy to scale, and fully supported by people who know the local sales landscape. We’re invested in your success and measure ours by the growth you achieve.

## Why Firmable? Because local beats global, every time

Global platforms often lack the depth, accuracy, and context needed to succeed in ANZ. Firmable is built from the ground up for this market – combining precise local data, AI sales intelligence, and a team in your time zone who has your back.

### Sell smarter with an AI platform built from the ground up

Our AI agents orchestrate sales plays based on buying signals and advanced account intelligence – helping your team prioritise high-intent prospects and optimise every touchpoint. This is AI designed for ANZ sales teams, fully embedded into your workflows.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/largest-b2b-database-1400x881-1.webp)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image-91-1-1400x1050-1.png)

### Own the most complete and accurate ANZ sales database

Say goodbye to patchy, out-of-date data. With over 1.5m companies and 10m verified contacts, Firmable delivers unrivalled coverage and accuracy – enriched with localised +61/64 mobile numbers, ABN/NZBN mapping, ANZSIC codes, and Do Not Call register checks. You get a data foundation built for ANZ that global platforms simply can’t match.

### Turn data into actions that your competitors miss

Firmable connects external market intelligence with your internal CRM data to uncover the best accounts to pursue and the right people to contact. Spot opportunities the moment they emerge, personalise your outreach, and start conversations that lead to more wins.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Sales-intelligence-Block-3.png)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/phone-support-2-1.png)

### Work with a partner who’s in your corner – and your time zone

From start-ups scaling outbound to enterprise sales teams, Firmable is easy to adopt, easy to scale, and fully supported by people who know the local sales landscape. We’re invested in your success and measure ours by the growth you achieve.

## Built for every sales role, all in one platform

Fill pipeline with in-market prospects, improve win rates with AI-powered prioritisation, and keep clear team visibility with less admin.

Learn more

### Sales development reps

Book more meetings by building ICP-fit lists fast, timing outreach off buying signals, and connecting via verified mobile numbers.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg-8.svg)

### Account executives

Focus on high-value deals, enter meetings with AI-generated account context, and enrich CRM records in seconds.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg.svg)

### Other GTM roles

Target the right audiences, source top talent, enrich your database, and track markets with ANZ-specific insights.

Learn more

## Why Firmable? Because local beats global, every time

Global platforms often lack the depth, accuracy, and context needed to succeed in ANZ. Firmable is built from the ground up for this market – combining precise local data, AI sales intelligence, and a team in your time zone who has your back.

### Sell smarter with an AI platform built from the ground up

Our AI agents orchestrate sales plays based on buying signals and advanced account intelligence – helping your team prioritise high-intent prospects and optimise every touchpoint. This is AI designed for ANZ sales teams, fully embedded into your workflows.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/largest-b2b-database-1400x881-1.webp)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image-91-1-1400x1050-1.png)

### Own the most complete and accurate ANZ sales database

Say goodbye to patchy, out-of-date data. With over 1.5m companies and 10m verified contacts, Firmable delivers unrivalled coverage and accuracy – enriched with localised +61/64 mobile numbers, ABN/NZBN mapping, ANZSIC codes, and Do Not Call register checks. You get a data foundation built for ANZ that global platforms simply can’t match.

### Turn data into actions that your competitors miss

Firmable connects external market intelligence with your internal CRM data to uncover the best accounts to pursue and the right people to contact. Spot opportunities the moment they emerge, personalise your outreach, and start conversations that lead to more wins.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Sales-intelligence-Block-3.png)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/phone-support-2-1.png)

### Work with a partner who’s in your corner – and your time zone

From start-ups scaling outbound to enterprise sales teams, Firmable is easy to adopt, easy to scale, and fully supported by people who know the local sales landscape. We’re invested in your success and measure ours by the growth you achieve.

## Firmable isn’t just quality data — it powers your outbound sales engine

## [Build high-quality prospect lists](https://firmable.com/sales-intelligence/)

- Access 1.5m verified ANZ companies and 10m decision-makers
[Access 1.5m verified ANZ companies and 10m decision-makers](https://firmable.com/sales-intelligence/)
- Use AI-powered search to build ICP-matched lists instantly
[Use AI-powered search to build ICP-matched lists instantly](https://firmable.com/sales-intelligence/)
- Filter by firmographics, tech stack, hiring trends, and more
[Filter by firmographics, tech stack, hiring trends, and more](https://firmable.com/sales-intelligence/)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image-91-1-1400x1050-1.png)

## [Monitor for important buying signals](https://firmable.com/ai-powered-sales-engine/)

- AI agents track role changes, funding rounds, tech adoption, and more
[AI agents track role changes, funding rounds, tech adoption, and more](https://firmable.com/ai-powered-sales-engine/)
- Prioritise outreach to key accounts showing in-market intent
[Prioritise outreach to key accounts showing in-market intent](https://firmable.com/ai-powered-sales-engine/)
- Keep track of customer movements and role changes to prevent churn
[Keep track of customer movements and role changes to prevent churn](https://firmable.com/ai-powered-sales-engine/)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/Frame-1597883025-768x576-1.png)

## [Convert more deals in less time](https://firmable.com/sales-engagement/)

- Cut research time with instant summaries and pre-call insights
[Cut research time with instant summaries and pre-call insights](https://firmable.com/sales-engagement/)
- Improve your sales conversations with more tailored, personalised messages
[Improve your sales conversations with more tailored, personalised messages](https://firmable.com/sales-engagement/)
- Effortlessly integrate with your existing CRM and outreach platforms
[Effortlessly integrate with your existing CRM and outreach platforms](https://firmable.com/sales-engagement/)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/Frame-1597883024-1.png)

[![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/image-91-1.png)](https://firmable.com/sales-intelligence/)

[![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/Frame-1597883024-1.png)](https://firmable.com/ai-powered-sales-engine/)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/Frame-1597883025-768x576-1.png)

## Why Firmable? Because local beats global, every time

Global platforms often lack the depth, accuracy, and context needed to succeed in ANZ. Firmable is built from the ground up for this market – combining precise local data, AI sales intelligence, and a team in your time zone who has your back.

### Sell smarter with an AI platform built from the ground up

Our AI agents orchestrate sales plays based on buying signals and advanced account intelligence – helping your team prioritise high-intent prospects and optimise every touchpoint. This is AI designed for ANZ sales teams, fully embedded into your workflows.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/largest-b2b-database-1400x881-1.webp)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image-91-1-1400x1050-1.png)

### Own the most complete and accurate ANZ sales database

Say goodbye to patchy, out-of-date data. With over 1.5m companies and 10m verified contacts, Firmable delivers unrivalled coverage and accuracy – enriched with localised +61/64 mobile numbers, ABN/NZBN mapping, ANZSIC codes, and Do Not Call register checks. You get a data foundation built for ANZ that global platforms simply can’t match.

### Turn data into actions that your competitors miss

Firmable connects external market intelligence with your internal CRM data to uncover the best accounts to pursue and the right people to contact. Spot opportunities the moment they emerge, personalise your outreach, and start conversations that lead to more wins.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Sales-intelligence-Block-3.png)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/phone-support-2-1.png)

### Work with a partner who’s in your corner – and your time zone

From start-ups scaling outbound to enterprise sales teams, Firmable is easy to adopt, easy to scale, and fully supported by people who know the local sales landscape. We’re invested in your success and measure ours by the growth you achieve.

## Built for every sales role, all in one platform

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Database-Solution-2.webp)

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg-7.svg)

### Sales leaders

Fill pipeline with in-market prospects, improve win rates with AI-powered prioritisation, and keep clear team visibility with less admin.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg-6.svg)

### Sales development reps

Book more meetings by building ICP-fit lists fast, timing outreach off buying signals, and connecting via verified mobile numbers.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg-8.svg)

### Account executives

Focus on high-value deals, enter meetings with AI-generated account context, and enrich CRM records in seconds.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Icon-svg.svg)

### Other GTM roles

Target the right audiences, source top talent, enrich your database, and track markets with ANZ-specific insights.

Learn more

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Group-1597882744.svg)

## We obsess about actionable insights

- Widest & deepest coverage

- Unique insights to trigger actions

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Icon-4.svg)

## We’re for every B2B company

- Easy-to-use platform
- Get started in minutes
- Priced to suit all businesses

## Frequently asked questions

How do I get started?

Head to our [sign up page](https://app.firmable.com/sign-up) to get started with a free 14-day trial or sign up immediately to one of our available plans. We’ll ask you a few questions then you’ll be ready to start searching for B2B data within minutes.

What is the difference between pricing plans?

Each plan offers different features and volumes of included profiles, depending on your company’s needs. See the table above for a comparison of inclusions.​

What are profiles?

A profile refers to a company profile or a people (contact) profile. It includes all contact or company information available for that profile, including mobiles and emails. A profile is ‘consumed’ when it is unlocked by viewing contact details or exported to a CRM or downloaded as an XLSX file. ​

What happens at the end of my trial?

You will roll into the paying subscription for the plan you choose at sign-up.

Will my plan renew automatically?

Yes, your plan renews automatically and your monthly or annual credits are issued automatically.

Can I cancel my subscription at any time?

If you’re on a monthly subscription, you can cancel your subscription at any time. If you’re on an annual subscription, you can cancel at any time but you’ll continue to have access to the platform for the remainder of your annual term. To cancel, once signed in, go to _Manage account > Plans and subscriptions > Modify/Cancel > Cancel plan_. We’d love the chance to say goodbye first and understand why you want to leave, so you can also contact [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com) or speak to your account executive.

We need to change the number of users on our plan. How will that work?

To update the number of users or change your subscription plan, just email our support team [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com), and we’ll get it sorted quickly and easily.

Do you have any plans for large team sizes or larger credit volume needs?

Absolutely, Firmable has plans for teams and data requirements of every size. If you don’t see something that suits your needs above, [contact our sales team](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss. We’d love to create your perfect plan.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major debit and credit cards including Visa, Mastercard, and AMEX. For annual subscriptions over 10 users, we can issue an invoice payable by bank transfer. Please contact us to arrange an invoice purchase. Monthly purchases must be paid for by credit card.

Is GST included in the price?

GST is included for Australian customers. If you’re based in New Zealand, GST is not included in the listed prices. Your checkout summary will automatically reflect the correct tax based on your billing location.

What is the pricing currency?

Australian dollars (AUD) for our Australian customers and NZD for New Zealand customers.

What is the construction module add-on option?

The [construction module](https://firmablestg.wpenginepowered.com/b2b-database-construction-companies-in-australia/) is an add-on option offering a deeper set of Australian construction company data including the ability to segment by industry-specific filters including org type (builder vs general contractor etc), sector (residential vs commercial etc), project specialisation, and more. It is available to customers on our Teams or Teams Pro Annual plans only for $40 extra per user after the 33% annual discount is applied.

Does Firmable offer a discount for not-for-profits?

Firmable is happy to offer eligible not-for-profit organisations a discount on any of our Teams annual plans. Please [contact us](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss.

What is the difference between 'profiles' and 'credits'?

At Firmable, profiles work like currency. 1 profile unlocked or downloaded = 1 credit in the platform. While other providers require you to use up to 5 credits for a single mobile number or email address, we keep it simple – just one profile (or ‘credit’) gives you everything you need. ​

## Grow your business faster with Firmable data

With the largest Australian & New Zealand B2B database and the only local support team, it’s easy to get started with Firmable.

## Frequently asked questions

How do I get started?

Head to our [sign up page](https://app.firmable.com/sign-up) to get started with a free 14-day trial or sign up immediately to one of our available plans. We’ll ask you a few questions then you’ll be ready to start searching for B2B data within minutes.

What is the difference between pricing plans?

Each plan offers different features and volumes of included profiles, depending on your company’s needs. See the table above for a comparison of inclusions.​

What are profiles?

A profile refers to a company profile or a people (contact) profile. It includes all contact or company information available for that profile, including mobiles and emails. A profile is ‘consumed’ when it is unlocked by viewing contact details or exported to a CRM or downloaded as an XLSX file. ​

What happens at the end of my trial?

You will roll into the paying subscription for the plan you choose at sign-up.

Will my plan renew automatically?

Yes, your plan renews automatically and your monthly or annual credits are issued automatically.

Can I cancel my subscription at any time?

If you’re on a monthly subscription, you can cancel your subscription at any time. If you’re on an annual subscription, you can cancel at any time but you’ll continue to have access to the platform for the remainder of your annual term. To cancel, once signed in, go to _Manage account > Plans and subscriptions > Modify/Cancel > Cancel plan_. We’d love the chance to say goodbye first and understand why you want to leave, so you can also contact [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com) or speak to your account executive.

We need to change the number of users on our plan. How will that work?

To update the number of users or change your subscription plan, just email our support team [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com), and we’ll get it sorted quickly and easily.

Do you have any plans for large team sizes or larger credit volume needs?

Absolutely, Firmable has plans for teams and data requirements of every size. If you don’t see something that suits your needs above, [contact our sales team](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss. We’d love to create your perfect plan.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major debit and credit cards including Visa, Mastercard, and AMEX. For annual subscriptions over 10 users, we can issue an invoice payable by bank transfer. Please contact us to arrange an invoice purchase. Monthly purchases must be paid for by credit card.

Is GST included in the price?

GST is included for Australian customers. If you’re based in New Zealand, GST is not included in the listed prices. Your checkout summary will automatically reflect the correct tax based on your billing location.

What is the pricing currency?

Australian dollars (AUD) for our Australian customers and NZD for New Zealand customers.

What is the construction module add-on option?

The [construction module](https://firmablestg.wpenginepowered.com/b2b-database-construction-companies-in-australia/) is an add-on option offering a deeper set of Australian construction company data including the ability to segment by industry-specific filters including org type (builder vs general contractor etc), sector (residential vs commercial etc), project specialisation, and more. It is available to customers on our Teams or Teams Pro Annual plans only for $40 extra per user after the 33% annual discount is applied.

Does Firmable offer a discount for not-for-profits?

Firmable is happy to offer eligible not-for-profit organisations a discount on any of our Teams annual plans. Please [contact us](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss.

What is the difference between 'profiles' and 'credits'?

At Firmable, profiles work like currency. 1 profile unlocked or downloaded = 1 credit in the platform. While other providers require you to use up to 5 credits for a single mobile number or email address, we keep it simple – just one profile (or ‘credit’) gives you everything you need. ​

## Frequently asked questions

How do I get started?

Head to our [sign up page](https://app.firmable.com/sign-up) to get started with a free 14-day trial or sign up immediately to one of our available plans. We’ll ask you a few questions then you’ll be ready to start searching for B2B data within minutes.

What is the difference between pricing plans?

Each plan offers different features and volumes of included profiles, depending on your company’s needs. See the table above for a comparison of inclusions.​

What are profiles?

A profile refers to a company profile or a people (contact) profile. It includes all contact or company information available for that profile, including mobiles and emails. A profile is ‘consumed’ when it is unlocked by viewing contact details or exported to a CRM or downloaded as an XLSX file. ​

What happens at the end of my trial?

You will roll into the paying subscription for the plan you choose at sign-up.

Will my plan renew automatically?

Yes, your plan renews automatically and your monthly or annual credits are issued automatically.

Can I cancel my subscription at any time?

If you’re on a monthly subscription, you can cancel your subscription at any time. If you’re on an annual subscription, you can cancel at any time but you’ll continue to have access to the platform for the remainder of your annual term. To cancel, once signed in, go to _Manage account > Plans and subscriptions > Modify/Cancel > Cancel plan_. We’d love the chance to say goodbye first and understand why you want to leave, so you can also contact [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com) or speak to your account executive.

We need to change the number of users on our plan. How will that work?

To update the number of users or change your subscription plan, just email our support team [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com), and we’ll get it sorted quickly and easily.

Do you have any plans for large team sizes or larger credit volume needs?

Absolutely, Firmable has plans for teams and data requirements of every size. If you don’t see something that suits your needs above, [contact our sales team](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss. We’d love to create your perfect plan.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major debit and credit cards including Visa, Mastercard, and AMEX. For annual subscriptions over 10 users, we can issue an invoice payable by bank transfer. Please contact us to arrange an invoice purchase. Monthly purchases must be paid for by credit card.

Is GST included in the price?

GST is included for Australian customers. If you’re based in New Zealand, GST is not included in the listed prices. Your checkout summary will automatically reflect the correct tax based on your billing location.

What is the pricing currency?

Australian dollars (AUD) for our Australian customers and NZD for New Zealand customers.

What is the construction module add-on option?

The [construction module](https://firmablestg.wpenginepowered.com/b2b-database-construction-companies-in-australia/) is an add-on option offering a deeper set of Australian construction company data including the ability to segment by industry-specific filters including org type (builder vs general contractor etc), sector (residential vs commercial etc), project specialisation, and more. It is available to customers on our Teams or Teams Pro Annual plans only for $40 extra per user after the 33% annual discount is applied.

Does Firmable offer a discount for not-for-profits?

Firmable is happy to offer eligible not-for-profit organisations a discount on any of our Teams annual plans. Please [contact us](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss.

What is the difference between 'profiles' and 'credits'?

At Firmable, profiles work like currency. 1 profile unlocked or downloaded = 1 credit in the platform. While other providers require you to use up to 5 credits for a single mobile number or email address, we keep it simple – just one profile (or ‘credit’) gives you everything you need. ​

## Why choose Firmable

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Icon-4.svg)

## We are deeply localised

- ANZ's definitive database
- Locally owned and supported
- AU & NZ - specific data registers

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Group-1597882744.svg)

## We obsess about actionable insights

- Widest & deepest coverage
- Most modern & current firmographics
- Unique insights to trigger actions

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Icon-4.svg)

## We’re for every B2B company

- Easy-to-use platform
- Get started in minutes

- Priced to suit all businesses

## Frequently asked questions

How do I get started?

Head to our [sign up page](https://app.firmable.com/sign-up) to get started with a free 14-day trial or sign up immediately to one of our available plans. We’ll ask you a few questions then you’ll be ready to start searching for B2B data within minutes.

What is the difference between pricing plans?

Each plan offers different features and volumes of included profiles, depending on your company’s needs. See the table above for a comparison of inclusions.​

What are profiles?

A profile refers to a company profile or a people (contact) profile. It includes all contact or company information available for that profile, including mobiles and emails. A profile is ‘consumed’ when it is unlocked by viewing contact details or exported to a CRM or downloaded as an XLSX file. ​

What happens at the end of my trial?

You will roll into the paying subscription for the plan you choose at sign-up.

Will my plan renew automatically?

Yes, your plan renews automatically and your monthly or annual credits are issued automatically.

Can I cancel my subscription at any time?

If you’re on a monthly subscription, you can cancel your subscription at any time. If you’re on an annual subscription, you can cancel at any time but you’ll continue to have access to the platform for the remainder of your annual term. To cancel, once signed in, go to _Manage account > Plans and subscriptions > Modify/Cancel > Cancel plan_. We’d love the chance to say goodbye first and understand why you want to leave, so you can also contact [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com) or speak to your account executive.

We need to change the number of users on our plan. How will that work?

To update the number of users or change your subscription plan, just email our support team [support@firmable.com](mailto:support@firmable.com), and we’ll get it sorted quickly and easily.

Do you have any plans for large team sizes or larger credit volume needs?

Absolutely, Firmable has plans for teams and data requirements of every size. If you don’t see something that suits your needs above, [contact our sales team](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss. We’d love to create your perfect plan.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major debit and credit cards including Visa, Mastercard, and AMEX. For annual subscriptions over 10 users, we can issue an invoice payable by bank transfer. Please contact us to arrange an invoice purchase. Monthly purchases must be paid for by credit card.

Is GST included in the price?

GST is included for Australian customers. If you’re based in New Zealand, GST is not included in the listed prices. Your checkout summary will automatically reflect the correct tax based on your billing location.

What is the pricing currency?

Australian dollars (AUD) for our Australian customers and NZD for New Zealand customers.

What is the construction module add-on option?

The [construction module](https://firmablestg.wpenginepowered.com/b2b-database-construction-companies-in-australia/) is an add-on option offering a deeper set of Australian construction company data including the ability to segment by industry-specific filters including org type (builder vs general contractor etc), sector (residential vs commercial etc), project specialisation, and more. It is available to customers on our Teams or Teams Pro Annual plans only for $40 extra per user after the 33% annual discount is applied.

Does Firmable offer a discount for not-for-profits?

Firmable is happy to offer eligible not-for-profit organisations a discount on any of our Teams annual plans. Please [contact us](https://firmable.com/contact-us/) to discuss.

What is the difference between 'profiles' and 'credits'?

At Firmable, profiles work like currency. 1 profile unlocked or downloaded = 1 credit in the platform. While other providers require you to use up to 5 credits for a single mobile number or email address, we keep it simple – just one profile (or ‘credit’) gives you everything you need. ​

## Grow your business faster with Firmable data

With the largest Australian & New Zealand B2B database and the only local support team, it’s easy to get started with Firmable.

![](https://firmable.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Vector.svg)

Hand off your busywork

What used to take days in minutes. Tell it your goal and watch it work.

* * *

It's like having a built-in power user that works alongside your team.

* * *

Knows everything you know

Searches all your pages, messages, files, and the web to surface exactly what you need.

* * *

Personalized to you

Your Agent learns how you work. You control everything from how it behaves to how it looks.

## Introducing Notion 3.0

[**Personal AgentNew** \\
You assign the tasks. Your Agent does the work.→](https://www.notion.com/product/ai/use-cases)

Hand off your busywork

What used to take days in minutes. Tell it your goal and watch it work.

* * *

Collaborates with your team

It's like having a built-in power user that works alongside your team.

* * *

Knows everything you know

Searches all your pages, messages, files, and the web to surface exactly what you need.

* * *

Personalized to you

Your Agent learns how you work. You control everything from how it behaves to how it looks.

## Questions & answers

How does Notion AI use my data?

We follow our standard [data protection practices](https://notion.so/security) to keep your data encrypted and private. Notion AI will not use your data to train our models unless you opt in to a request to share your data.

Any information used to power Notion AI will be shared with AI subprocessors for the sole purpose of providing you with the Notion AI features. We specifically have contractual agreements in place with our AI subprocessors that prohibit the use of customer data to train their models. [Learn more about Notion AI security and privacy practices here](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-ai-security-practices).

Where can I find my invoices?

Workspace admins can access, view, and download your workspace's invoices by going to `Settings & members` → `Billing`, then scrolling to `Invoices`. There you can click on "View invoice" to see the invoice PDF.

What are your accepted payment methods?

We currently accept all major credit and debit card brands.

What is a block?

A block is any single piece of content you add to your page, like a paragraph of text, a to-do item, an image, a code block, an embedded file, etc. Think of your page as being made up of these building blocks. Learn more about blocks [here →](https://www.notion.com/help/what-is-a-block)

What happens when I go over the block storage limit on a Free Plan?

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace by yourself, you’ll be able to add as many pages and blocks as you like.

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace with multiple members, you’ll be able to add a limited number of blocks before you have to upgrade.

When you reach the limit, you can still read, edit, and organize existing content blocks as usual, but you won’t be able to add new content blocks.

Do you offer student discounts?

The Plus Plan (with a 1-member limit) is free for students and educators. Compared to the Free Plan, you’ll be able to add more guests, have access to more version history, and upload larger files.

Just sign up with your school email address and you’ll immediately gain access to these features. Thousands of school email domains are eligible, not just .edu!

For more info & FAQs, [visit the Notion for Education page](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-for-education).

What do the different analytics tiers mean?

**Basic page analytics (Free and Plus Plans):** Includes a list of page viewers as well as a chart displaying views over time.

**Advanced page analytics** **(Business Plan):** Includes everything above as well as a list of page editors.

**Workspace analytics (Enterprise Plan):** Includes everything above as well as user level analytics, analytics on all pages in your workspace, and search analytics for content in your workspace.

How is pricing calculated for the paid plans?

If you upgrade your workspace to one of the paid plans, you will be charged a fee per member.

Guests are free of charge – but they can only access individual pages they are invited to. In other words, guests won’t be able to see all the team pages under the `Teamspaces` section in the left sidebar.

How do I get charged when I add members to my workspace?

When you add a new member to your workspace, they will use an existing paid seat if you have any available in your workspace. If you do not have any existing available paid seats, your count of paid seats will increase by 1. Changes in membership that occur mid-month will create prorated charges based on the amount of time remaining in the billing cycle when the paid seat was added.

For every member you delete from your workspace, you will open up 1 available paid seat. This means you have the option to exchange members in your workspace without paying any additional costs, as long as your total billable seat count remains the same.

You’ll receive an invoice for any charges accrued by changes in membership on your selected payment method, on the day of the month you initially signed up for your subscription.

Each time your billing period starts (monthly or annual), your count of paid seats will be synchronized so it exactly matches the amount of members present in your workspace.

How does adding and removing members work?

Whether you're on a monthly or yearly billing schedule, your account may be charged on a monthly basis if you make changes in membership. If you added members, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left when a user was added. If you removed members, you will not receive credit but instead will still have use of that seat for a different user for the remainder of the billing period.

How are paid seats counted?

A paid seat can be thought of as a license for one member to use your Notion workspace. Workspace owners can view the total paid seat count for their workspace by going to `Settings & members` \> `Billing`. Once you have added a paid seat, you will keep it for the duration of your billing period.

When your billing cycle renews, either monthly or annually, you will be charged for your plan amount multiplied by the number of members in your workspace, plus any prorated charges for new paid seats added in the past month. Your number of paid seats will be recalculated at each renewal to match the number of members present in the workspace.

What happens when I change plans?

- **Upgrading your plan:** Your account will be upgraded and charged immediately. The amount due will be reduced based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time the plan was changed.

- **Downgrading your plan:** Your account will be downgraded at the end of your billing cycle. Learn about how your features may be impacted after a downgrade [here →](https://notion.com/help/plan-downgrade)


How do I cancel my paid plan?

Your Notion subscription, annual or monthly, will automatically renew until you cancel it. You can cancel your subscription by going to `Settings` in the left-hand sidebar on a desktop computer, then selecting `Billing`, then `Change plan`. After you cancel, you’ll still have access to all the paid features until the end of your billing cycle.

Learn more about billing in [this article](https://www.notion.com/help/billing-and-payment-info).

What happens if my payment fails? Like if my credit card expires?

Your account email will be notified after each failed payment. Payments may be retried up to 8 times within the next month.

After this, if the payment did not succeed, your workspace will get restricted to limited-access for a period of time before being downgraded to the Free plan.

Can I change my payment method?

You can change your payment method at any time in your billing settings.

How do refunds work?

Our refund policy is simple. If you believe you've made a mistake signing up for a paid Notion subscription online or in-app, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). We'll be happy to refund you the full amount (not pro-rated) if you downgrade your subscription within three days of signing up for monthly billing, or within 30 days of signing up for annual billing.

If you have accidentally added members to your workspace, you can remove those members at any time. If you’ve been charged for members who were accidentally added, we're happy to provide a refund of the prorated charges if you reach out within three days of the invoice date (please make sure the additional members have been removed from your workspace when writing in).

And if for any reason you're unhappy with Notion, please let us know at [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com) — we'd love to hear your feedback, and will be happy to work with you to create the best experience possible.

What if I live in a region with a mandatory refund policy?

If you live in the European Union, United Kingdom, or another region with a mandatory refund policy, you may be eligible for a monthly subscription refund past 72 hours. For example, customers in the European Union can receive a full refund for a monthly subscription within 14 days of purchase, rather than 72 hours.

To request a refund, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). If you live in a region with a mandatory refund policy, please let us know and we'll be happy to assist you.

Still have more questions?

Learn more in our [help center](https://www.notion.com/help/guides).

Questions & answers

How does Notion AI use my data?

We follow our standard data protection practices to keep your data encrypted and private. Notion AI will not use your data to train our models unless you opt in to a request to share your data.

Any information used to power Notion AI will be shared with AI subprocessors for the sole purpose of providing you with the Notion AI features. We specifically have contractual agreements in place with our AI subprocessors that prohibit the use of customer data to train their models. Learn more about Notion AI security and privacy practices here.

Where can I find my invoices?

Workspace admins can access, view, and download your workspace's invoices by going to Settings & members → Billing, then scrolling to Invoices. There you can click on "View invoice" to see the invoice PDF.

What are your accepted payment methods?

We currently accept all major credit and debit card brands.

What is a block?

A block is any single piece of content you add to your page, like a paragraph of text, a to-do item, an image, a code block, an embedded file, etc. Think of your page as being made up of these building blocks. Learn more about blocks here →

What happens when I go over the block storage limit on a Free Plan?

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace by yourself, you’ll be able to add as many pages and blocks as you like.

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace with multiple members, you’ll be able to add a limited number of blocks before you have to upgrade.

When you reach the limit, you can still read, edit, and organize existing content blocks as usual, but you won’t be able to add new content blocks.

Do you offer student discounts?

The Plus Plan (with a 1-member limit) is free for students and educators. Compared to the Free Plan, you’ll be able to add more guests, have access to more version history, and upload larger files.

Just sign up with your school email address and you’ll immediately gain access to these features. Thousands of school email domains are eligible, not just .edu!

For more info & FAQs, visit the Notion for Education page.

What do the different analytics tiers mean?

Basic page analytics (Free and Plus Plans): Includes a list of page viewers as well as a chart displaying views over time.

Advanced page analytics (Business Plan): Includes everything above as well as a list of page editors.

Workspace analytics (Enterprise Plan): Includes everything above as well as user level analytics, analytics on all pages in your workspace, and search analytics for content in your workspace.

How is pricing calculated for the paid plans?

If you upgrade your workspace to one of the paid plans, you will be charged a fee per member.

Guests are free of charge – but they can only access individual pages they are invited to. In other words, guests won’t be able to see all the team pages under the Teamspaces section in the left sidebar.

How do I get charged when I add members to my workspace?

When you add a new member to your workspace, they will use an existing paid seat if you have any available in your workspace. If you do not have any existing available paid seats, your count of paid seats will increase by 1. Changes in membership that occur mid-month will create prorated charges based on the amount of time remaining in the billing cycle when the paid seat was added.

For every member you delete from your workspace, you will open up 1 available paid seat. This means you have the option to exchange members in your workspace without paying any additional costs, as long as your total billable seat count remains the same.

You’ll receive an invoice for any charges accrued by changes in membership on your selected payment method, on the day of the month you initially signed up for your subscription.

Each time your billing period starts (monthly or annual), your count of paid seats will be synchronized so it exactly matches the amount of members present in your workspace.

How does adding and removing members work?

Whether you're on a monthly or yearly billing schedule, your account may be charged on a monthly basis if you make changes in membership. If you added members, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left when a user was added. If you removed members, you will not receive credit but instead will still have use of that seat for a different user for the remainder of the billing period.

How are paid seats counted?

A paid seat can be thought of as a license for one member to use your Notion workspace. Workspace owners can view the total paid seat count for their workspace by going to Settings & members > Billing. Once you have added a paid seat, you will keep it for the duration of your billing period.

When your billing cycle renews, either monthly or annually, you will be charged for your plan amount multiplied by the number of members in your workspace, plus any prorated charges for new paid seats added in the past month. Your number of paid seats will be recalculated at each renewal to match the number of members present in the workspace.

What happens when I change plans?

  • Upgrading your plan: Your account will be upgraded and charged immediately. The amount due will be reduced based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time the plan was changed.

  • Downgrading your plan: Your account will be downgraded at the end of your billing cycle. Learn about how your features may be impacted after a downgrade here →

How do I cancel my paid plan?

Your Notion subscription, annual or monthly, will automatically renew until you cancel it. You can cancel your subscription by going to Settings in the left-hand sidebar on a desktop computer, then selecting Billing, then Change plan. After you cancel, you’ll still have access to all the paid features until the end of your billing cycle.

Learn more about billing in this article.

What happens if my payment fails? Like if my credit card expires?

Your account email will be notified after each failed payment. Payments may be retried up to 8 times within the next month.

After this, if the payment did not succeed, your workspace will get restricted to limited-access for a period of time before being downgraded to the Free plan.

Can I change my payment method?

You can change your payment method at any time in your billing settings.

How do refunds work?

Our refund policy is simple. If you believe you've made a mistake signing up for a paid Notion subscription online or in-app, please contact us inside the app or email team@makenotion.com. We'll be happy to refund you the full amount (not pro-rated) if you downgrade your subscription within three days of signing up for monthly billing, or within 30 days of signing up for annual billing.

If you have accidentally added members to your workspace, you can remove those members at any time. If you’ve been charged for members who were accidentally added, we're happy to provide a refund of the prorated charges if you reach out within three days of the invoice date (please make sure the additional members have been removed from your workspace when writing in).

And if for any reason you're unhappy with Notion, please let us know at team@makenotion.com — we'd love to hear your feedback, and will be happy to work with you to create the best experience possible.

What if I live in a region with a mandatory refund policy?

If you live in the European Union, United Kingdom, or another region with a mandatory refund policy, you may be eligible for a monthly subscription refund past 72 hours. For example, customers in the European Union can receive a full refund for a monthly subscription within 14 days of purchase, rather than 72 hours.

To request a refund, please contact us inside the app or email team@makenotion.com. If you live in a region with a mandatory refund policy, please let us know and we'll be happy to assist you.

Still have more questions?
Learn more in our help center.

## Questions & answers

How does Notion AI use my data?

We follow our standard [data protection practices](https://notion.so/security) to keep your data encrypted and private. Notion AI will not use your data to train our models unless you opt in to a request to share your data.

Any information used to power Notion AI will be shared with AI subprocessors for the sole purpose of providing you with the Notion AI features. We specifically have contractual agreements in place with our AI subprocessors that prohibit the use of customer data to train their models. [Learn more about Notion AI security and privacy practices here](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-ai-security-practices).

Where can I find my invoices?

Workspace admins can access, view, and download your workspace's invoices by going to `Settings & members` → `Billing`, then scrolling to `Invoices`. There you can click on "View invoice" to see the invoice PDF.

What are your accepted payment methods?

We currently accept all major credit and debit card brands.

What is a block?

A block is any single piece of content you add to your page, like a paragraph of text, a to-do item, an image, a code block, an embedded file, etc. Think of your page as being made up of these building blocks. Learn more about blocks [here →](https://www.notion.com/help/what-is-a-block)

What happens when I go over the block storage limit on a Free Plan?

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace by yourself, you’ll be able to add as many pages and blocks as you like.

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace with multiple members, you’ll be able to add a limited number of blocks before you have to upgrade.

When you reach the limit, you can still read, edit, and organize existing content blocks as usual, but you won’t be able to add new content blocks.

Do you offer student discounts?

The Plus Plan (with a 1-member limit) is free for students and educators. Compared to the Free Plan, you’ll be able to add more guests, have access to more version history, and upload larger files.

Just sign up with your school email address and you’ll immediately gain access to these features. Thousands of school email domains are eligible, not just .edu!

For more info & FAQs, [visit the Notion for Education page](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-for-education).

What do the different analytics tiers mean?

**Basic page analytics (Free and Plus Plans):** Includes a list of page viewers as well as a chart displaying views over time.

**Advanced page analytics** **(Business Plan):** Includes everything above as well as a list of page editors.

**Workspace analytics (Enterprise Plan):** Includes everything above as well as user level analytics, analytics on all pages in your workspace, and search analytics for content in your workspace.

How is pricing calculated for the paid plans?

If you upgrade your workspace to one of the paid plans, you will be charged a fee per member.

Guests are free of charge – but they can only access individual pages they are invited to. In other words, guests won’t be able to see all the team pages under the `Teamspaces` section in the left sidebar.

How do I get charged when I add members to my workspace?

When you add a new member to your workspace, they will use an existing paid seat if you have any available in your workspace. If you do not have any existing available paid seats, your count of paid seats will increase by 1. Changes in membership that occur mid-month will create prorated charges based on the amount of time remaining in the billing cycle when the paid seat was added.

For every member you delete from your workspace, you will open up 1 available paid seat. This means you have the option to exchange members in your workspace without paying any additional costs, as long as your total billable seat count remains the same.

You’ll receive an invoice for any charges accrued by changes in membership on your selected payment method, on the day of the month you initially signed up for your subscription.

Each time your billing period starts (monthly or annual), your count of paid seats will be synchronized so it exactly matches the amount of members present in your workspace.

How does adding and removing members work?

Whether you're on a monthly or yearly billing schedule, your account may be charged on a monthly basis if you make changes in membership. If you added members, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left when a user was added. If you removed members, you will not receive credit but instead will still have use of that seat for a different user for the remainder of the billing period.

How are paid seats counted?

A paid seat can be thought of as a license for one member to use your Notion workspace. Workspace owners can view the total paid seat count for their workspace by going to `Settings & members` \> `Billing`. Once you have added a paid seat, you will keep it for the duration of your billing period.

When your billing cycle renews, either monthly or annually, you will be charged for your plan amount multiplied by the number of members in your workspace, plus any prorated charges for new paid seats added in the past month. Your number of paid seats will be recalculated at each renewal to match the number of members present in the workspace.

What happens when I change plans?

- **Upgrading your plan:** Your account will be upgraded and charged immediately. The amount due will be reduced based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time the plan was changed.

- **Downgrading your plan:** Your account will be downgraded at the end of your billing cycle. Learn about how your features may be impacted after a downgrade [here →](https://notion.com/help/plan-downgrade)

How do I cancel my paid plan?

Your Notion subscription, annual or monthly, will automatically renew until you cancel it. You can cancel your subscription by going to `Settings` in the left-hand sidebar on a desktop computer, then selecting `Billing`, then `Change plan`. After you cancel, you’ll still have access to all the paid features until the end of your billing cycle.

Learn more about billing in [this article](https://www.notion.com/help/billing-and-payment-info).

What happens if my payment fails? Like if my credit card expires?

Your account email will be notified after each failed payment. Payments may be retried up to 8 times within the next month.

After this, if the payment did not succeed, your workspace will get restricted to limited-access for a period of time before being downgraded to the Free plan.

Can I change my payment method?

You can change your payment method at any time in your billing settings.

How do refunds work?

Our refund policy is simple. If you believe you've made a mistake signing up for a paid Notion subscription online or in-app, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). We'll be happy to refund you the full amount (not pro-rated) if you downgrade your subscription within three days of signing up for monthly billing, or within 30 days of signing up for annual billing.

If you have accidentally added members to your workspace, you can remove those members at any time. If you’ve been charged for members who were accidentally added, we're happy to provide a refund of the prorated charges if you reach out within three days of the invoice date (please make sure the additional members have been removed from your workspace when writing in).

And if for any reason you're unhappy with Notion, please let us know at [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com) — we'd love to hear your feedback, and will be happy to work with you to create the best experience possible.

What if I live in a region with a mandatory refund policy?

If you live in the European Union, United Kingdom, or another region with a mandatory refund policy, you may be eligible for a monthly subscription refund past 72 hours. For example, customers in the European Union can receive a full refund for a monthly subscription within 14 days of purchase, rather than 72 hours.

To request a refund, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). If you live in a region with a mandatory refund policy, please let us know and we'll be happy to assist you.

Still have more questions?

Learn more in our [help center](https://www.notion.com/help/guides).

## Questions & answers

How does Notion AI use my data?

We follow our standard [data protection practices](https://notion.so/security) to keep your data encrypted and private. Notion AI will not use your data to train our models unless you opt in to a request to share your data.

Any information used to power Notion AI will be shared with AI subprocessors for the sole purpose of providing you with the Notion AI features. We specifically have contractual agreements in place with our AI subprocessors that prohibit the use of customer data to train their models. [Learn more about Notion AI security and privacy practices here](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-ai-security-practices).

Where can I find my invoices?

Workspace admins can access, view, and download your workspace's invoices by going to `Settings & members` → `Billing`, then scrolling to `Invoices`. There you can click on "View invoice" to see the invoice PDF.

What are your accepted payment methods?

We currently accept all major credit and debit card brands.

What is a block?

A block is any single piece of content you add to your page, like a paragraph of text, a to-do item, an image, a code block, an embedded file, etc. Think of your page as being made up of these building blocks. Learn more about blocks [here →](https://www.notion.com/help/what-is-a-block)

What happens when I go over the block storage limit on a Free Plan?

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace by yourself, you’ll be able to add as many pages and blocks as you like.

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace with multiple members, you’ll be able to add a limited number of blocks before you have to upgrade.

When you reach the limit, you can still read, edit, and organize existing content blocks as usual, but you won’t be able to add new content blocks.

Do you offer student discounts?

The Plus Plan (with a 1-member limit) is free for students and educators. Compared to the Free Plan, you’ll be able to add more guests, have access to more version history, and upload larger files.

Just sign up with your school email address and you’ll immediately gain access to these features. Thousands of school email domains are eligible, not just .edu!

For more info & FAQs, [visit the Notion for Education page](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-for-education).

What do the different analytics tiers mean?

**Basic page analytics (Free and Plus Plans):** Includes a list of page viewers as well as a chart displaying views over time.

**Advanced page analytics** **(Business Plan):** Includes everything above as well as a list of page editors.

**Workspace analytics (Enterprise Plan):** Includes everything above as well as user level analytics, analytics on all pages in your workspace, and search analytics for content in your workspace.

How is pricing calculated for the paid plans?

If you upgrade your workspace to one of the paid plans, you will be charged a fee per member.

Guests are free of charge – but they can only access individual pages they are invited to. In other words, guests won’t be able to see all the team pages under the `Teamspaces` section in the left sidebar.

How do I get charged when I add members to my workspace?

When you add a new member to your workspace, they will use an existing paid seat if you have any available in your workspace. If you do not have any existing available paid seats, your count of paid seats will increase by 1. Changes in membership that occur mid-month will create prorated charges based on the amount of time remaining in the billing cycle when the paid seat was added.

For every member you delete from your workspace, you will open up 1 available paid seat. This means you have the option to exchange members in your workspace without paying any additional costs, as long as your total billable seat count remains the same.

You’ll receive an invoice for any charges accrued by changes in membership on your selected payment method, on the day of the month you initially signed up for your subscription.

Each time your billing period starts (monthly or annual), your count of paid seats will be synchronized so it exactly matches the amount of members present in your workspace.

How does adding and removing members work?

Whether you're on a monthly or yearly billing schedule, your account may be charged on a monthly basis if you make changes in membership. If you added members, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left when a user was added. If you removed members, you will not receive credit but instead will still have use of that seat for a different user for the remainder of the billing period.

How are paid seats counted?

A paid seat can be thought of as a license for one member to use your Notion workspace. Workspace owners can view the total paid seat count for their workspace by going to `Settings & members` \> `Billing`. Once you have added a paid seat, you will keep it for the duration of your billing period.

When your billing cycle renews, either monthly or annually, you will be charged for your plan amount multiplied by the number of members in your workspace, plus any prorated charges for new paid seats added in the past month. Your number of paid seats will be recalculated at each renewal to match the number of members present in the workspace.

What happens when I change plans?

- **Upgrading your plan:** Your account will be upgraded and charged immediately. The amount due will be reduced based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time the plan was changed.

- **Downgrading your plan:** Your account will be downgraded at the end of your billing cycle. Learn about how your features may be impacted after a downgrade [here →](https://notion.com/help/plan-downgrade)


How do I cancel my paid plan?

Your Notion subscription, annual or monthly, will automatically renew until you cancel it. You can cancel your subscription by going to `Settings` in the left-hand sidebar on a desktop computer, then selecting `Billing`, then `Change plan`. After you cancel, you’ll still have access to all the paid features until the end of your billing cycle.

Learn more about billing in [this article](https://www.notion.com/help/billing-and-payment-info).

What happens if my payment fails? Like if my credit card expires?

Your account email will be notified after each failed payment. Payments may be retried up to 8 times within the next month.

After this, if the payment did not succeed, your workspace will get restricted to limited-access for a period of time before being downgraded to the Free plan.

Can I change my payment method?

You can change your payment method at any time in your billing settings.

How do refunds work?

Our refund policy is simple. If you believe you've made a mistake signing up for a paid Notion subscription online or in-app, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). We'll be happy to refund you the full amount (not pro-rated) if you downgrade your subscription within three days of signing up for monthly billing, or within 30 days of signing up for annual billing.

If you have accidentally added members to your workspace, you can remove those members at any time. If you’ve been charged for members who were accidentally added, we're happy to provide a refund of the prorated charges if you reach out within three days of the invoice date (please make sure the additional members have been removed from your workspace when writing in).

And if for any reason you're unhappy with Notion, please let us know at [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com) — we'd love to hear your feedback, and will be happy to work with you to create the best experience possible.

What if I live in a region with a mandatory refund policy?

If you live in the European Union, United Kingdom, or another region with a mandatory refund policy, you may be eligible for a monthly subscription refund past 72 hours. For example, customers in the European Union can receive a full refund for a monthly subscription within 14 days of purchase, rather than 72 hours.

To request a refund, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). If you live in a region with a mandatory refund policy, please let us know and we'll be happy to assist you.

Still have more questions?

Learn more in our [help center](https://www.notion.com/help/guides).

## Questions & answers

How does Notion AI use my data?

We follow our standard [data protection practices](https://notion.so/security) to keep your data encrypted and private. Notion AI will not use your data to train our models unless you opt in to a request to share your data.

Any information used to power Notion AI will be shared with AI subprocessors for the sole purpose of providing you with the Notion AI features. We specifically have contractual agreements in place with our AI subprocessors that prohibit the use of customer data to train their models. [Learn more about Notion AI security and privacy practices here](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-ai-security-practices).

Where can I find my invoices?

Workspace admins can access, view, and download your workspace's invoices by going to `Settings & members` → `Billing`, then scrolling to `Invoices`. There you can click on "View invoice" to see the invoice PDF.

What are your accepted payment methods?

We currently accept all major credit and debit card brands.

What is a block?

A block is any single piece of content you add to your page, like a paragraph of text, a to-do item, an image, a code block, an embedded file, etc. Think of your page as being made up of these building blocks. Learn more about blocks [here →](https://www.notion.com/help/what-is-a-block)

What happens when I go over the block storage limit on a Free Plan?

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace by yourself, you’ll be able to add as many pages and blocks as you like.

If you’re using a Free Plan workspace with multiple members, you’ll be able to add a limited number of blocks before you have to upgrade.

When you reach the limit, you can still read, edit, and organize existing content blocks as usual, but you won’t be able to add new content blocks.

Do you offer student discounts?

The Plus Plan (with a 1-member limit) is free for students and educators. Compared to the Free Plan, you’ll be able to add more guests, have access to more version history, and upload larger files.

Just sign up with your school email address and you’ll immediately gain access to these features. Thousands of school email domains are eligible, not just .edu!

For more info & FAQs, [visit the Notion for Education page](https://www.notion.so/help/notion-for-education).

What do the different analytics tiers mean?

**Basic page analytics (Free and Plus Plans):** Includes a list of page viewers as well as a chart displaying views over time.

**Advanced page analytics** **(Business Plan):** Includes everything above as well as a list of page editors.

**Workspace analytics (Enterprise Plan):** Includes everything above as well as user level analytics, analytics on all pages in your workspace, and search analytics for content in your workspace.

How is pricing calculated for the paid plans?

If you upgrade your workspace to one of the paid plans, you will be charged a fee per member.

Guests are free of charge – but they can only access individual pages they are invited to. In other words, guests won’t be able to see all the team pages under the `Teamspaces` section in the left sidebar.

How do I get charged when I add members to my workspace?

When you add a new member to your workspace, they will use an existing paid seat if you have any available in your workspace. If you do not have any existing available paid seats, your count of paid seats will increase by 1. Changes in membership that occur mid-month will create prorated charges based on the amount of time remaining in the billing cycle when the paid seat was added.

For every member you delete from your workspace, you will open up 1 available paid seat. This means you have the option to exchange members in your workspace without paying any additional costs, as long as your total billable seat count remains the same.

You’ll receive an invoice for any charges accrued by changes in membership on your selected payment method, on the day of the month you initially signed up for your subscription.

Each time your billing period starts (monthly or annual), your count of paid seats will be synchronized so it exactly matches the amount of members present in your workspace.

How does adding and removing members work?

Whether you're on a monthly or yearly billing schedule, your account may be charged on a monthly basis if you make changes in membership. If you added members, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left when a user was added. If you removed members, you will not receive credit but instead will still have use of that seat for a different user for the remainder of the billing period.

How are paid seats counted?

A paid seat can be thought of as a license for one member to use your Notion workspace. Workspace owners can view the total paid seat count for their workspace by going to `Settings & members` \> `Billing`. Once you have added a paid seat, you will keep it for the duration of your billing period.

When your billing cycle renews, either monthly or annually, you will be charged for your plan amount multiplied by the number of members in your workspace, plus any prorated charges for new paid seats added in the past month. Your number of paid seats will be recalculated at each renewal to match the number of members present in the workspace.

What happens when I change plans?

- **Upgrading your plan:** Your account will be upgraded and charged immediately. The amount due will be reduced based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time the plan was changed.

- **Downgrading your plan:** Your account will be downgraded at the end of your billing cycle. Learn about how your features may be impacted after a downgrade [here →](https://notion.com/help/plan-downgrade)


How do I cancel my paid plan?

Your Notion subscription, annual or monthly, will automatically renew until you cancel it. You can cancel your subscription by going to `Settings` in the left-hand sidebar on a desktop computer, then selecting `Billing`, then `Change plan`. After you cancel, you’ll still have access to all the paid features until the end of your billing cycle.

Learn more about billing in [this article](https://www.notion.com/help/billing-and-payment-info).

What happens if my payment fails? Like if my credit card expires?

Your account email will be notified after each failed payment. Payments may be retried up to 8 times within the next month.

After this, if the payment did not succeed, your workspace will get restricted to limited-access for a period of time before being downgraded to the Free plan.

Can I change my payment method?

You can change your payment method at any time in your billing settings.

How do refunds work?

Our refund policy is simple. If you believe you've made a mistake signing up for a paid Notion subscription online or in-app, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). We'll be happy to refund you the full amount (not pro-rated) if you downgrade your subscription within three days of signing up for monthly billing, or within 30 days of signing up for annual billing.

If you have accidentally added members to your workspace, you can remove those members at any time. If you’ve been charged for members who were accidentally added, we're happy to provide a refund of the prorated charges if you reach out within three days of the invoice date (please make sure the additional members have been removed from your workspace when writing in).

And if for any reason you're unhappy with Notion, please let us know at [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com) — we'd love to hear your feedback, and will be happy to work with you to create the best experience possible.

What if I live in a region with a mandatory refund policy?

If you live in the European Union, United Kingdom, or another region with a mandatory refund policy, you may be eligible for a monthly subscription refund past 72 hours. For example, customers in the European Union can receive a full refund for a monthly subscription within 14 days of purchase, rather than 72 hours.

To request a refund, please contact us inside the app or email [team@makenotion.com](mailto:team@makenotion.com). If you live in a region with a mandatory refund policy, please let us know and we'll be happy to assist you.

Still have more questions?

Learn more in our [help center](https://www.notion.com/help/guides).
